revised_title: The Chemical Action of Bacillus cloacae on Glucose and Mannitol
tldr: The author investigates the chemical action of Bacillus cloacae on glucose and mannitol, finding that the substances produced include acetic acid, lactic acid, succinic acid, formic acid, ethyl alcohol, carbon dioxide, and hydrogen. The study also reveals differences in the relative proportions of these products compared to other bacteria like B. lactis aerogenes and B. coli communis.
